text: In fact the teacher of the module is very language ambivalent, and the key focus of the module is always how to do X rather than how to use X tool.

text: As an undergrad I learned to code using C and that was painful. I wish we started on python and then went down to C.

elements.text: As an undergrad I learned to code using C and that was painful. I wish we started on python and then went down to C.

text: The argument in my department regarding the language used in undergraduate courses is that they want to maximise the possibilities of students getting jobs after graduation, and knowing python is nowadays a more requested ability than julia, for example.

text: My undergraduate school put CS in the faculty of engineering, no degree-required credits for science students. There were a few intro to programming courses sprinkled across the other departments, primarily Physics which taught us all Fortran. I think they finally switched to python, but not before I accidentally took down the entire research compute server trying to run a legendarily bad implementation for an assignment.
